markdown: <::A black and white illustration depicts a young man and a young woman, both smiling and looking at each other. The man is on the left, wearing a collared shirt with a bow tie under a sweater, and is holding a book in his left arm. The woman is on the right, wearing a collared shirt under a sweater, and is holding two books in her right arm. Both have short, styled hair. The image has a halftone dot pattern, typical of older print media. : illustration::> ## For a Bright Smile There's nothing like a good smile to make you popu-lar among your friends. Two things go to make up a charming smile --- sparkling eyes and beautiful teeth. Your eyes will sparkle if you have the good health that comes from eating, every day, a variety of nour- ishing foods—meat, fish, eggs, fruits, vegetables, en- riched and whole grain breads and cereals. Brushing your teeth regularly after eating removes the food particles clinging to the teeth and helps pre- vent tooth decay. The teeth should be brushed in such a way as to reach every possible surface, and as di- rected by your dentist. If you do not have access to a toothbrush after meals or after eating snacks between meals, rinse your mouth with water to remove the food particles adhering to the teeth. Visit your dentist regularly. Remember, your den-tist is your friend and he will help you to have good-looking teeth. <::A black and white illustration depicting various food items and a person cooking. On the left, there is a steak, two fish, two apples, and some leaves. Moving towards the right, there are more leaves, a loaf of bread, and other indistinct food items. Further to the right, a person is shown cooking over a stove or counter, with pots and other kitchen elements visible. The overall composition suggests a progression from raw ingredients to prepared food.: figure::> 16 17 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/phwk0226

chunks.markdown: <::A black and white illustration depicts a young man and a young woman, both smiling and looking at each other. The man is on the left, wearing a collared shirt with a bow tie under a sweater, and is holding a book in his left arm. The woman is on the right, wearing a collared shirt under a sweater, and is holding two books in her right arm. Both have short, styled hair. The image has a halftone dot pattern, typical of older print media. : illustration::>
## For a Bright Smile There's nothing like a good smile to make you popu-lar among your friends. Two things go to make up a charming smile --- sparkling eyes and beautiful teeth.

Your eyes will sparkle if you have the good health that comes from eating, every day, a variety of nour- ishing foods—meat, fish, eggs, fruits, vegetables, en- riched and whole grain breads and cereals.

Brushing your teeth regularly after eating removes the food particles clinging to the teeth and helps pre- vent tooth decay. The teeth should be brushed in such a way as to reach every possible surface, and as di- rected by your dentist.
If you do not have access to a toothbrush after meals or after eating snacks between meals, rinse your mouth with water to remove the food particles adhering to the teeth.
Visit your dentist regularly. Remember, your den-tist is your friend and he will help you to have good-looking teeth.

<::A black and white illustration depicting various food items and a person cooking. On the left, there is a steak, two fish, two apples, and some leaves. Moving towards the right, there are more leaves, a loaf of bread, and other indistinct food items. Further to the right, a person is shown cooking over a stove or counter, with pots and other kitchen elements visible. The overall composition suggests a progression from raw ingredients to prepared food.: figure::>
